verses.verse: Is there not an appointed time <S%H6635><s%> to man <S%H582><s%> upon earth <S%H776><s%>? are not his days <S%H3117><s%> also like the days <S%H3117><s%> of an hireling <S%H7916><s%>? an appointed: or, a warfare

As a servant <S%H5650><s%> earnestly desireth <S%H7602><s%> the shadow <S%H6738><s%>, and as an hireling <S%H7916><s%> looketh <S%H6960><s%> for the reward of his work <S%H6467><s%>: earnestly: Heb. gapeth after
So am I made to possess <S%H5157><s%> months <S%H3391><s%> of vanity <S%H7723><s%>, and wearisome <S%H5999><s%> nights <S%H3915><s%> are appointed <S%H4487><s%> to me.

When I lie down <S%H7901><s%>, I say <S%H559><s%>, When shall I arise <S%H6965><s%>, and the night <S%H6153><s%> be gone <S%H4059><s%>? and I am full <S%H7646><s%> of tossings to and fro <S%H5076><s%> unto the dawning of the day <S%H5399><s%>. the night: Heb. the evening be measured?

My flesh <S%H1320><s%> is clothed <S%H3847><s%> with worms <S%H7415><s%> and clods <S%H1487><s%> of dust <S%H6083><s%>; my skin <S%H5785><s%> is broken <S%H7280><s%>, and become loathsome <S%H3988><s%>.
My days <S%H3117><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than a weaver's shuttle <S%H708><s%>, and are spent <S%H3615><s%> without <S%H657><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%>.

O remember <S%H2142><s%> that my life <S%H2416><s%> is wind <S%H7307><s%>: mine eye <S%H5869><s%> shall no more <S%H7725><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>. shall: Heb. shall not return see: to see, that is, to enjoy
The eye <S%H5869><s%> of him that hath seen <S%H7210><s%> me shall see <S%H7789><s%> me no more: thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon me, and I am not. I am: that is, I can live no longer
As the cloud <S%H6051><s%> is consumed <S%H3615><s%> and vanisheth away <S%H3212><s%>: so he that goeth down <S%H3381><s%> to the grave <S%H7585><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> no more.
He shall return <S%H7725><s%> no more to his house <S%H1004><s%>, neither shall his place <S%H4725><s%> know <S%H5234><s%> him any more.

Therefore I will not refrain <S%H2820><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%>; I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the anguish <S%H6862><s%> of my spirit <S%H7307><s%>; I will complain <S%H7878><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%>.
Am I a sea <S%H3220><s%>, or a whale <S%H8577><s%>, that thou settest <S%H7760><s%> a watch <S%H4929><s%> over me?
When I say <S%H559><s%>, My bed <S%H6210><s%> shall comfort <S%H5162><s%> me, my couch <S%H4904><s%> shall ease <S%H5375><s%> my complaint <S%H7879><s%>;
Then thou scarest <S%H2865><s%> me with dreams <S%H2472><s%>, and terrifiest <S%H1204><s%> me through visions <S%H2384><s%>:
So that my soul <S%H5315><s%> chooseth <S%H977><s%> strangling <S%H4267><s%>, and death <S%H4194><s%> rather than my life <S%H6106><s%>. life: Heb. bones
I loathe <S%H3988><s%> it; I would not live <S%H2421><s%> alway <S%H5769><s%>: let me alone <S%H2308><s%>; for my days <S%H3117><s%> are vanity <S%H1892><s%>.
What is man <S%H582><s%>, that thou shouldest magnify <S%H1431><s%> him? and that thou shouldest set <S%H7896><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> upon him?
And that thou shouldest visit <S%H6485><s%> him every morning <S%H1242><s%>, and try <S%H974><s%> him every moment <S%H7281><s%>?
How long <S%H4100><s%> wilt thou not depart <S%H8159><s%> from me, nor let me alone <S%H7503><s%> till I swallow down <S%H1104><s%> my spittle <S%H7536><s%>?

I have sinned <S%H2398><s%>; what shall I do <S%H6466><s%> unto thee, O thou preserver <S%H5341><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>? why hast thou set <S%H7760><s%> me as a mark <S%H4645><s%> against thee, so that I am a burden <S%H4853><s%> to myself?

And why dost thou not pardon <S%H5375><s%> my transgression <S%H6588><s%>, and take away <S%H5674><s%> mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>? for now shall I sleep <S%H7901><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>; and thou shalt seek me in the morning <S%H7836><s%>, but I shall not be.
